headline: Justices Wary In Weighing ‘Bridgegate’ As a Crime
abstract: Justices across the ideological spectrum seemed wary of allowing prosecutions based on officials’ misrepresentations about the reasons for their actions.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Closing access lanes to the George Washington Bridge to punish a political opponent in 2013 was a scandal, one that helped doom the presidential ambitions of Chris Christie, the New Jersey governor at the time. On Tuesday, a skeptical Supreme Court considered whether the incident — “Bridgegate,” in the tabloid shorthand — was also a crime.
keywords: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
